5.1     Pharmacodynamic properties

Element: Pharmacotherapeutic group: Sex hormones and modulators of the genital systems, gonadotropins, ATC code: G03GA05.
Text: Pharmacotherapeutic group: Sex hormones and modulators of the genital systems, gonadotropins, ATC code: G03GA05.

Element: Ovaleap is a biosimilar medicinal product. Detailed information is available on the website of the European Medicines Agency http://www.ema.europa.eu.
Text: Ovaleap is a biosimilar medicinal product. Detailed information is available on the website of the European Medicines Agency http://www.ema.europa.eu.
Pharmacodynamic effects

Element: In women, the most important effect resulting from parenteral administration of FSH is the development of mature Graafian follicles. In women with anovulation, the object of follitropin alfatherapy is to develop a single mature Graafian follicle from which the ovum will be liberated after the administration of hCG.
Text: In women, the most important effect resulting from parenteral administration of FSH is the development of mature Graafian follicles. In women with anovulation, the object of follitropin alfatherapy is to develop a single mature Graafian follicle from which the ovum will be liberated after the administration of hCG.

Element: Clinical efficacy and safety in women
Text: Clinical efficacy and safety in women

Element: In clinical trials, patients with severe FSH and LH deficiency were defined by an endogenous serum LH level < 1.2 IU/L as measured in a central laboratory. However, it should be taken into account that there are variations between LH measurements performed in different laboratories.
Text: In clinical trials, patients with severe FSH and LH deficiency were defined by an endogenous serum LH level < 1.2 IU/L as measured in a central laboratory. However, it should be taken into account that there are variations between LH measurements performed in different laboratories.

Element: In clinical studies comparing r-hFSH (follitropin alfa) and urinary FSH in ART (see table 3 below) and in ovulation induction, follitropin alfa was more potent than urinary FSH in terms of a lower total dose and a shorter treatment period needed to trigger follicular maturation.
Text: In clinical studies comparing r-hFSH (follitropin alfa) and urinary FSH in ART (see table 3 below) and in ovulation induction, follitropin alfa was more potent than urinary FSH in terms of a lower total dose and a shorter treatment period needed to trigger follicular maturation.

Element: In ART, follitropin alfa at a lower total dose and shorter treatment period than urinary FSH, resulted in a higher number of oocytes retrieved when compared to urinary FSH.

Element: Clinical efficacy and safety in men
Text: Clinical efficacy and safety in men

Element: In men deficient in FSH, follitropin alfa administered concomitantly with hCG for at least 4 months induces spermatogenesis.

5.2     Pharmacokinetic properties

Element: Following intravenous administration, follitropin alfa is distributed to the extracellular fluid space with an initial half-life of around 2 hours and eliminated from the body with a terminal half-life of about one day. The steady state volume of distribution and total clearance are 10 L and 0.6 L/h, respectively. One‑eighth of the follitropin alfa dose is excreted in the urine.
Text: Following intravenous administration, follitropin alfa is distributed to the extracellular fluid space with an initial half-life of around 2 hours and eliminated from the body with a terminal half-life of about one day. The steady state volume of distribution and total clearance are 10 L and 0.6 L/h, respectively. One‑eighth of the follitropin alfa dose is excreted in the urine.

Element: Following subcutaneous administration, the absolute bioavailability is about 70 %. Following repeated administration, follitropin alfa accumulates 3‑fold achieving a steady-state within 3‑4 days. In women whose endogenous gonadotropin secretion is suppressed, follitropin alfa has nevertheless been shown to effectively stimulate follicular development and steroidogenesis, despite unmeasurable LH levels.
Text: Following subcutaneous administration, the absolute bioavailability is about 70 %. Following repeated administration, follitropin alfa accumulates 3‑fold achieving a steady-state within 3‑4 days. In women whose endogenous gonadotropin secretion is suppressed, follitropin alfa has nevertheless been shown to effectively stimulate follicular development and steroidogenesis, despite unmeasurable LH levels.

Element: 5.3 Preclinical safety data
Text: 5.3     Preclinical safety data

Element: Non-clinical data reveal no special hazard for humans based on conventional studies of single and repeated dose toxicity and genotoxicity additional to that already stated in other sections of this SmPC.
Text: Non-clinical data reveal no special hazard for humans based on conventional studies of single and repeated dose toxicity and genotoxicity additional to that already stated in other sections of this SmPC.

Element: Impaired fertility has been reported in rats exposed to pharmacological doses of follitropin alfa (≥ 40 IU/kg/day) for extended periods, through reduced fecundity.
Text: Impaired fertility has been reported in rats exposed to pharmacological doses of follitropin alfa (≥ 40 IU/kg/day) for extended periods, through reduced fecundity.

Element: Given in high doses (≥ 5 IU/kg/day) follitropin alfa caused a decrease in the number of viable foetuses without being a teratogen and dystocia similar to that observed with urinary Menopausal Gonadotropin (hMG). However, since Ovaleap is not indicated in pregnancy, these data are of limited clinical relevance.
Text: Given in high doses (≥ 5 IU/kg/day) follitropin alfa caused a decrease in the number of viable foetuses without being a teratogen and dystocia similar to that observed with urinary Menopausal Gonadotropin (hMG). However, since Ovaleap is not indicated in pregnancy, these data are of limited clinical relevance.
